alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Rensselaer; Eastern Schenectady; Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Saratoga; Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Schoharie; Southern Fulton; Southern Saratoga; Western Albany; Western Greene; Western Rensselaer; Western Schenectady; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 18 at 3:30AM EST until February 18 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The southern Adirondacks, Mohawk Valley, Schoharie Valley, eastern Catskills, Capital District, Lake George Saratoga Region, and southern Vermont. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The combination of snowmelt, frozen ground and rainfall will lead to runoff into rivers and streams into this evening. This runoff may allow for river ice to break up in some areas, which could cause ice jams and lead to localized flooding. In addition, a few rivers may reach minor flood stage and the Mettawee River at Granville could reach moderate flood stage. Flooding of poor drainage areas is also possible, especially where snow or ice clogs storm drains. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
